channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A comprehensive list of 2024 tech layoffs
item.description: A complete list of all the known layoffs in tech, from Big Tech to startups, broken down by month throughout 2024. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reser...

item.title: How NASA Might Change Under Donald Trump
item.description: The Trump transition team is looking for “big changes” at NASA—including some cuts.

item.title: OpenAI ‘considered’ building a humanoid robot: Report
item.description: OpenAI has recently explored building its own humanoid robot, according to The Information. The report cites “two people with direct knowledge” of tho...

item.title: Woosh Smart Air Filter Review: No More Guessing
item.description: I spent nearly a year with Woosh's smart air filter, which can give you a better idea of when to replace your home's HVAC filter.

item.title: Give Your Social Health a Decent Workout
item.description: Your physical and mental well-being are crucial—but the picture isn’t complete if you aren’t flexing your connection muscles, too. Here’s how to build...

item.title: Sony’s CES 2025 press conference: How to watch
item.description: Sony knows how to put on a show at CES. The company’s pressers are high-octane, star-studded affairs, as these things go. In addition to standard Sony...

item.title: Sephora Promo Codes and Deals: Save Up to 50%
item.description: Find best-selling cosmetics, fragrances, and beauty products for up to half the price at Sephora.

item.title: The promise and perils of synthetic data
item.description: Is it possible for an AI to be trained just on data generated by another AI? It might sound like a harebrained idea. But it’s one that’s been around f...

item.title: Home Is Where the Couch Is: Photos by Natcha Wongchanglaw
item.description: Natcha Wongchanglaw’s Couchsurfing photos explore how travel turns transient encounters into meaningful—and vulnerable—moments.

item.title: Onyx Motorbikes is back, one year after its owner died leaving the company in shambles
